conbody.p: Shakespeare languages have three modes of running available: embedded within your Haskell source, stored in a separate file and compiled into the executable, or loaded from an external file at runtime. The last, called debug mode, is perfect for rapid development. The first two both allow for incredibly fast production code with minimal file dependencies. Also, it's very easy to switch between external file and debug mode. The default scaffolded Yesod site handles this with a single preprocessor variable.
